content.rendered:
[vc_row][vc_column width=”2/3″][vc_column_text]

Overview :

Cosmetic dentistry is dental work that improves the appearance  of a person’s Teeth,  Gums  and/or  Smile. Cosmetic dentistry refers to a host of dental treatments designed to enhance the smile and correct chipped, cracked, discolored, and unevenly spaced teeth.


Porcelain Veneers :
Porcelain dental veneers are a beautiful way to correct stained, chipped, or crooked teeth. Veneers are an important tool for the cosmetic dentist. A dentist may use one veneer to restore a single tooth that may have been fractured or discolored, or multiple teeth to create a “Hollywood” type of makeover.

 

Porcelain Crowns :
Porcelain crowns are one of the most popular treatments in dental cosmetics, together with porcelain veneers and whitening. A crown is a type of dental restoration available in different types of material  which completely caps or encircles a tooth or dental implant. Crowns are often needed when a large cavity threatens the ongoing health of a tooth.

 

Natural Tooth Whitening :
Dental bleaching, also known as tooth whitening, is a common procedure in  the field of cosmetic dentistry. It lightens  teeth shade & helps to remove stains & discolouration. Whitening is among the most popular cosmetic dental procedures because it can greatly improve how your teeth look. The effects of bleaching can last for several months, but may vary depending on the lifestyle of the patient. Factors that decrease whitening include smoking and drinking dark colored liquids like coffee, tea,  red wine & eating  berries.

Fixed Teeth Replacement :
In a normal, healthy mouth, chewing function is well balanced since each upper tooth has proper contact and function with corresponding lower teeth. But, this natural proper balance is quickly destroyed when a tooth is lost. Our Cosmetic Dentist  deals with the restoration and maintenance of oral function, comfort, appearance, and health of the patient by the restoration and replacement  of the missing natural teeth.

Full Mouth Reconstruction/Rehabilitation :
Reconstructive dentistry refers to any restorative dentistry procedure that involves replacing or repairing broken or missing teeth, bones, or tissue. If severe dental problems are causing you discomfort, you may be a good candidate for a full mouth reconstruction. Full Mouth Rehabilitation corrects imperfections in bite position and enhances the appearance of the smile.

Gum Reshaping :
Gum contouring, also known as gum reshaping, is a treatment that involves shortening, lengthening or leveling out the gum in order to create a nicer smile and in some cases improved oral hygiene. Gum Reshaping (Gum Lift) is a straightforward, quick and painless procedure carried out by our  professional Cosmetic Dentist using a specialist Diode Laser  i.e. Biolase.

 

Cosmetic Dentures :
Just because you may only have a few teeth or even no teeth doesn’t mean you can’t have the perfect smile you always dreamed of ! With the latest Cosmetic dentistry procedures , we can make you great looking cosmetic dentures and comfortable partial dentures.

Dental Bonding :
Bonding will lighten any stains you may have on your teeth,  close up minor gaps and can be used to correct crooked teeth. The dental bonding procedure utilizes a composite resin and is used for a variety of structural as well as cosmetic purposes. Dental bonding is a dental procedure in which a dentist applies a tooth-colored resin material (a durable plastic material) and hardens it with a special UV  light. This ultimately “bonds” the material to the tooth and improves the overall appearance of teeth.

White Filling/Composite filling :
Composite resin filings or white fillings are the most common used fillings at our office. White Fillings or Cosmetic fillings  enable you to maintain your beautiful white smile even if you require treatment. A composite filling is a tooth-colored plastic and glass mixture used to restore decayed teeth. Composites are also used for cosmetic improvements of the smile by changing the color of the teeth or reshaping disfigured teeth.

Dental Bridges :
A bridge stabilizes the bite of a patient who is missing one or more teeth. Dental bridges are meant to replace missing teeth by “bridging” the gap between two remaining teeth. This involves creation of a pontic (false tooth) with a dental crown on either side. The crowns are fitted over the remaining teeth to hold the false tooth in place. A bridge is fabricated by reducing the teeth on either side of the missing tooth or teeth by a preparation pattern determined by the location of the teeth and by the material from which the bridge is fabricated.

Dental Jewellry
Teeth jewellry is a brilliant way to add sparkles to your smile and stand out of the crowd. Tooth jewellry is the latest thing in cosmetic dentistry  and it is  popular with people of all ages. Surprise your friends with a sparkling crystal glass design, or something in gold with a twinkle of ruby or diamond. These tiny little  Swarovski  designs are great fun, and because there’s no drilling involved, they won’t harm your teeth .

 

 

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/3″][stm_sidebar sidebar=”812″][/vc_column][/vc_row]
